channel.title: Comments on: Thing learned for the day

item.title: By: Jack Ratcliff
item.dc:creator: Jack Ratcliff
item.description: <p>Actually, the sorting doesn't matter. In fact, the only requirement is that the view you are deleting from exists. The document doesn't even have to appear in the view. In fact, it can be a folder which is even better since a view consumes some resources on the server to keep its index updated. What I have done in the past is just setup a dedicated hidden folder called something like "(Delete)" and then, when you want to delete a doc you just call db/(delete)/unid?DeleteDocument.<br /></p>
item.content:encoded: Actually, the sorting doesn’t matter. In fact, the only requirement is that the view you are deleting from exists. The document doesn’t even have to appear in the view. In fact, it can be a folder which is even better since a view consumes some resources on the server to keep its index updated. What I have done in the past is just setup a dedicated hidden folder called something like “(Delete)” and then, when you want to delete a doc you just call db/(delete)/unid?DeleteDocument.
